forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 74. Southwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.shortForecast: Patchy Fog then Slight Chance Showers And Thunderstorms
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog before 7am, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms between 1pm and 2pm, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms. Partly sunny, with a high near 92. Heat index values as high as 101. West wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the pre-dawn hours greet Boston, the city lies shrouded in a delicate veil of patchy fog, offering an ethereal quality to the landscape. The sky bears a blanket of clouds, and the warm air holds the promise of a sultry day ahead. This morning, you may experience a hint of clinging humidity before the sun breaks free from the horizon, ultimately inviting warmth to chase away the enveloping mist.

As the day unfolds, the atmosphere will dance between clouds and occasional bursts of sunlight, with the temperature climbing toward a summery peak. A flirtation with scattered showers and the rumble of distant thunderstorms adds a touch of unpredictability. Dressing in layers will be wise; a light shirt or breathable fabric will suit the heat, while a casual jacket might be prudent for those moments of shifting weather. Given the impending warmth and humidity, venturing outdoors could be delightful—perhaps a leisurely stroll through the local park, where the symphony of cicadas creates a buzz of life. Alternatively, seeking a cozy café corner to sip an iced coffee while watching the world go by may prove equally satisfying as the day greets its full brightness.
